properties.name: Aerosmith - I Don't Want To Miss A Thing
properties.description: Posted by TredubzeddLate Summer, 1998 -- My first kiss occurred after I watched Armageddon with Erin. Later that week, we came to this park and made our relationship official with more kissing.

properties.name: Apartment 26 - Give Me More
properties.description: Posted by TredubzeddEarly Spring, 2005 -- Working on the first iteration of MixFlix.com for my father, I was sitting at my computer, with the window open to let in the spring breeze, and my music playing loudly. I had to get up and dance around like a fool to this one.

properties.name: Beastie Boys - Fight For Your Right To Party
properties.description: Posted by Tredubzedd Late 1994 to Early 1995 -- Riding in the back of a Wrangler on the way to school, I was introduced to all sorts of new music. And all sorts of coldness -- I remember multiple times making the drive through snow or rain, with the top off.

properties.name: Bond - Oceanic
properties.description: Posted by TredubzeddEarly Autumn, 2001 -- I was nearing the end of my mission, and stopped in a music store on a "P-day". This song was playing.

properties.name: Cherry Poppin' Daddies - Zoot Suit Riot
properties.description: Posted by TredubzeddMid-Spring, 1998 -- Senior Prom. Instead of a tux, I rented a classy pinstripe zoot suit. Unfortunately, the night turned out to be entirely awkward. Dinner was good, but I had a ladybug in my salad. My date was my ex-girlfriend (who was my girlfriend at the time I asked her to the dance). I was in love with someone else\'s date. And I borrowed Mom\'s car, a manual transmission, when I had only known automatics.

properties.name: Fuel - Hemorrhage
properties.description: Posted by TredubzeddApril, 2006 -- A bunch of people from the ward got together at Jenny\'s to hang out, eat dessert, and watch Lost. Rachael (on whom I was beginning to develop a large crush) complained about having a song stuck in her head. I handed her my iPod and suggested that she pick one to sing (she sings extremely well). She came across this song, said she liked it, and then spent a few moments trying to remember the tune. She would gaze off, staring at nothing in particular, and as she remembered bits and pieces, she would smile and start nodding her head in rhythm. It was really cute.

properties.name: Goo Goo Dolls - Black Balloon
properties.description: Posted by TredubzeddLate 1997-Early 1998 -- At the time, this song got real old, real fast. It was on one of the MovieTunes CDs, which played in the theatre over and over, all day long.

properties.name: Howie Day - Collide
properties.description: Posted by TredubzeddOctober 27, 2006 -- It was the first time I had ever been to a corn maze. Zarah and I separated ourselves from the rest of the group almost immediately upon entry, and quickly got ourselves lost. I\'d kiss her whenever we hit a dead end, and when this song came on we stopped to dance.

properties.name: Ini Kamoze - Hot Steppa
properties.description: Posted by TredubzeddFall 1994-Spring 1995 -- A bunch of us would walk to McDonald\'s every Thursday for lunch. Due to a block schedule, we had more than two hours to kill before we had to be back on campus. We would play cards, usually Spades, and overload on free-refill caffeine. I would go to my French class afterwards, and absolutely crash. This song got stuck in my head on multiple occasions while we played. I blame the Dr. Pepper.

properties.name: Kenny Wayne Shepherd Band - Blue on Black
properties.description: Posted by TredubzeddSummer, 2003 -- I was hanging out with my friend Bronwen at her apartment, and she had this song playing. I remember her chasing me down after I had dropped her off here (on a different occasion), because her front door wouldn\'t unlock.

properties.name: Lifehouse - Breathing
properties.description: Posted by TredubzeddApril, 2003 -- Erin took me with her to do some Easter shopping for her roommates (her favorite holiday). Wal-Mart started playing this song, and Erin remarked that she really liked it.

properties.name: Pixies - Where Is My Mind?
properties.description: Posted by TredubzeddSpring, 2001 -- I was serving an LDS mission, and living with a kid named David Gleave in this apartment. He told me of this song (it was his favorite), which I didn\'t hear until well after I had gotten home.

properties.name: Righteous Brothers - Unchained Melody
properties.description: Posted by Tredubzedd  Summer, 2004 -- Erin and Sarah took me "home" with them for a week. I was dating Sarah at the time, and I set this song up one night for a slow dance in her basement.

properties.name: Soul Asylum - Runaway Train
properties.description: Posted by TredubzeddLate 1996-Early 1997 -- I had this song stuck in my head, so I scribbled a few of the lyrics on my desk in my chemistry class. The next day, a response was written, and I started a conversation with some unknown individual, who later identified himself as "The Village Idiot". It turns out my buddy Brian, who called himself by that name on numerous occasions, shared that desk.

properties.name: Splender - I Think God Can Explain
properties.description: Posted by TredubzeddEarly Spring, 2004 -- The girl I had been chasing for years had recently started dating a guy named Sam, signaling to me that any chance I might have had was lost. I wrote the lyrics to this song in a note, and placed them with some flowers (Erin\'s favorites) on the windshield of her car as a "goodbye".

properties.name: Sugar Ray - Every Morning
properties.description: Posted by TredubzeddLate Spring, 1999 -- A neighboring dorm building was hosting a dance, which Meth and I attended in hopes of hooking up with some unknown faces. This was one song played, and the only one I remember being played.

properties.name: Sugar Ray - Out The Window
properties.description: Posted by TredubzeddLate 2001 -- I had just gotten back from serving a Latter-Day Saint mission for two years in Europe, and upon my return, nothing was the same. Initially, this song seemed an applicable theme.

properties.name: Vertical Horizon - Grey Sky Morning (Best I Ever Had)
properties.description: Posted by TredubzeddEarly Spring, 2002 -- I was cuddling with Lindsey, and we were discussing music we enjoyed. She mentioned this song, which I didn\'t recognize immediately, but later came to enjoy.
